abstract.p: Correction; chart on April 4 on auto sales in March gave incorrect rankings on 'How Automakers Fared'; corrected chart appears

block.p: A chart yesterday on auto sales in March gave incorrect rankings on "How Automakers Fared." A corrected chart appears below.
DAIMLERCHRYSLER March 2007 Sales: 228,047 Adjusted Change*: - 7.5% Market Share: 14.9%
FORD March 2007 Sales: 255,444 Adjusted Change*: -13.5 Market Share: 16.7
GENERAL MOTORS March 2007 Sales: 345,668 Adjusted Change*: - 7.4 Market Share: 22.5
HONDA March 2007 Sales: 143,392 Adjusted Change*: + 7.4 Market Share: 9.3
HYUNDAI March 2007 Sales: 41,984 Adjusted Change*: - 3.1 Market Share: 2.7
NISSAN March 2007 Sales: 111,141 Adjusted Change*: + 3.9 Market Share: 7.2
TOYOTA March 2007 Sales: 242,675 Adjusted Change*: + 7.7 Market Share: 15.8
Sales for DaimlerChrysler include Mercedes; sales for Ford include Volvo and Land Rover; sales for General Motors include Saab.
*Based on average daily sales adjusted for any differences in the number of selling days in a month.
(Source by Ward's AutoInfoBank)
